title.english: Such a wish for divine love manifested.

commentary: Meera (a.k.a. Mirabai) was a celebrated 16th-century Hindu Bhakti poet.
Born into royalty, legend states that the young princess fled home and became a wandering mystic - seeking to connect with the loving Divine.

One of the earliest references to her comes from medieval-era Sikh literature; the 'Prem Ambodh Pothi' (Book of Divine Love - c. 1693CE), a text attributed to Guru Gobind Singh (either written or patronized by) [1].
In this text, Mirabai is remembered for her devotion to Giridhar (Krishna), revealed to be the form of the All-Pervading Divine.
In the end of Mirabai's chapter in 'Prem Ambodh Pothi', her detractors eventually recognize her as One with the Divine - fully merged, without differences.
footnotes: [1] See 'Mirabai in the Pothi Prem Ambodh' by J.S. Hawley & G.S. Mann.
[2] Hari is the supreme Self; an alternative name for Vishnu or Krishna.
[3] A female form of the masculine 'yogi'; ascetic monks.
[4] Govind and Gopal are alternative names of Krishna.
[6] Divine nectar ('amrit' is a cognate of 'ambrosia').
[7] After Meera's father attempts to poison her; he eventually recognizes her as the All-Pervading Divine.'
lyrics: aisi lagi lagan, meera hogi magan
Such a wish for divine love manifested, that Meera became completely enamored.
woh to gali gali hari gun gaane lagi
Indeed, on every trail and path, she began singing the virtues of 'Hari' [2].
mehalo meh pali, bankay jogan chali
Raised in a royal mansion, yet she departed, wearing robes of an ascetic 'yogan' [3].
meera rani deewani kahanay lagi
Meera, the princess, has begun to call herself, 'the mad and devoted lover'.
koyi rokay nahi koyi tokay nahi
No one could stop her, no one could reprimand her!
meera govind gopal gaanay lagi
Meera began to sing of 'Govind' and 'Gopal' [4]
baithi santo ke sang, rangi mohan ke rang
She sat in the congregation of the enlightened, immersed in the love of her Beloved.
meera premi pritam ko mananay lagi
Through loving devotion, she attempts to make her loving Beloved agreeable.
woh to gali gali hari gun gaane lagi
Indeed, on every trail and path, she began singing the virtues of 'Hari' [2].
aisi lagi lagan, meera hogi magan
Such a wish for divine love manifested, that Meera became completely enamored.
rana ne vish diya, mano amrit piya
The king [5] gave her poison - Meera accepted it and drank it as amrit [6].
meera sagar saritha samanay lagi
Meera manifested everywhere, like the all encompassing ocean [7].
dukh lakho sahe, mukh say govind kahe
Bearing thousands of pains, yet from her mouth she voices only, 'Govind'.
meera govind gopal gaanay lagi
Meera began to sing of 'Govind' and 'Gopal' [4]
